item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。投资者在等待关键的美国通胀指标，交易员在判断特朗普的信念所带来的影响，戴尔公司在人工智能方面未能达到高预期后出现下滑。以下是市场动态。【原文：Good morning. Investors wait for a key US inflation gauge, traders judge the impact of Trump’s conviction and Dell slumps after failing to meet lofty expectations on AI. Here’s what’s moving markets. — David Goodman】

item.title: 尼日利亚小组寻求将税收数量削减约 87
item.description: 尼日利亚计划将这个非洲人口最多的国家的税收数量减少 87% 以上，以方便居民纳税，增加财政收入。【原文：Nigeria plans to reduce the number of levies in Africa’s most-populous nation by more than 87% in a bid to make it easier for residents to pay taxes and boost revenue.】

item.title: 日本上月投入 620 亿美元干预日元汇率，创历史新高
item.description: 在过去的一个月里，日本为支撑日元花费了创纪录的 9.8 万亿日元（622 亿美元），超过了 2022 年日元兑美元跌至 34 年低点后日本为保护日元所使用的金额。【原文：Japan spent a record ¥9.8 trillion ($62.2 billion) in the past month to prop up the yen, surpassing the amount it used in 2022 to defend the currency after it fell to a 34-year low against the dollar.】

item.title: 非洲开发银行称非洲难以承受 750 亿美元的利息支出
item.description: 非洲开发银行（African Development Bank）的数据显示，非洲国家今年将花费 750 亿美元用于支付债务利息，而这些钱正是它们在社会支出和公共投资等紧迫问题上所急需的。【原文：African nations will spend $75 billion on debt interest payments this year, money they desperately need for pressing issues such as social spending and public investments, according to the African Development Bank.】

item.title: 中国要求债券承销商检查地方债务风险
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的一份通知，中国市场监管部门本周要求一些金融公司审查任何可能违背政府化解地方债务风险计划的债券承销行为。【原文：A Chinese market watchdog asked some financial firms this week to review any bond underwriting that may have gone against government plans to defuse local debt risks, according to a notice seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 经济学家斯蒂芬-罗奇：美国面临与中国 "永远 "打贸易战的风险
item.description: 经济学家斯蒂芬-罗奇（Stephen Roach）批评美国对华贸易政策是一个 "错误"，有可能造成两国之间无休止的经济冲突。【原文：Economist Stephen Roach criticized US trade policies against China as a “blunder” that risks creating an endless economic conflict between the two nations.】

item.title: 中国誓言进一步调查恒大欺诈案当事人
item.description: 中国市场监管机构誓言继续调查涉及中国恒大集团涉嫌欺诈的 "中介机构"。【原文：China’s market regulator vowed to press ahead with a probe into “intermediary agencies” involved in an alleged fraud by China Evergrande Group.】

item.title: 新加坡指定 ST 物流公司和壳牌为关键实体
item.description: 新加坡将 ST Logistics Pte.和壳牌石油公司（Shell Plc）的本地部门等九家公司定为对经济至关重要的公司，这一分类将加强政府对涉及这些公司的任何收购行动的监督。【原文：Singapore designated nine companies, including ST Logistics Pte. and Shell Plc’s local unit, as critical to the economy, a classification that will heighten government oversight on any takeover moves involving these firms.】

item.description: 欧元区通胀加速超过预期—；这进一步给欧洲中央银行下周计划降息后的利率前景蒙上了阴影。【原文：Euro-area inflation accelerated more than anticipated — further clouding the outlook for European Central Bank interest rates after next week’s planned cut.】

item.title: 帕内塔称欧洲央行现在减息可避免日后 "迟缓仓促 "行动
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员法比奥-帕内塔（Fabio Panetta）说，欧洲中央银行不应该推迟降息，因为这样做最终只会迫使在稍后阶段采取更激烈的行动。【原文：The European Central Bank shouldn’t delay interest-rate cuts because doing so can just end up forcing more drastic action at a later stage, Governing Council member Fabio Panetta said.】

item.title: 德雷福斯下台十三年后，韦拉特攫取 26 亿欧元
item.description: 雅克-韦拉特（Jacques Veyrat）在与前老板遗孀的权力斗争中败下阵来，作为退出方案的一部分，获得了现在名为 Neoen SA 的可再生能源业务。现在，他即将从这笔交易中获得 26 亿欧元（约合 28 亿美元）。【原文：Jacques Veyrat received the renewable energy business now known as Neoen SA as part of an exit package after losing a power struggle with the widow of his former boss. Now he’s on the verge of pocketing €2.6 billion ($2.8 billion) from its sale.】

item.title: 德意志银行第二季度交易收入将下降
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）首席财务官詹姆斯-冯-莫尔特克（James von Moltke）表示，第二季度固定收益交易收入将出现下降，这将低于分析师的预期。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG Chief Financial Officer James von Moltke said that fixed-income trading revenue is set to drop in the second quarter, in what would be a miss of analysts’ expectations.】

item.title: 中国科技股走向技术性调整
item.description: 随着获利回吐和地缘政治不确定性的重现，中国科技股有望进入技术性调整。【原文：China’s technology stocks are on course to enter into a technical correction as profit-taking and renewed geopolitical uncertainties weigh on the gauge.】

item.title: 汇丰力争在七月前选定首席执行官奎因的继任者
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）正力争在未来几周内完成首席执行官人选的物色工作，该行倾向于从内部任命下一任老板。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc is pushing to wrap up the search for a chief executive officer in the coming weeks, with the bank edging toward appointing its next boss from within its own ranks.】

item.title: 土耳其经济在加息启动前出现井喷式增长
item.description: 今年年初，土耳其的经济增长速度加快，对一系列旨在抑制国内需求的激进加息措施保持了免疫力。【原文：Turkey’s economy grew at a faster pace to start the year, remaining immune to a series of aggressive interest-rate increases meant to muffle domestic demand.】

item.title: 法国通胀率今年首次因能源而加快
item.description: 就在欧洲中央银行准备降低利率之际，法国通胀率今年首次加速上升，反映了该地区其他国家的趋势。【原文：French inflation accelerated for the first time this year — mirroring trends elsewhere in the region just as the European Central Bank prepares to lower interest rates.】

item.title: 美国银行警告 "超老龄化 "韩国将失去魔力
item.description: 根据美国银行（Bank of America）的预测，随着人口老龄化削弱了国家的活力，并加强了经济的逆风，韩国的平均经济增长率将在 2030 年代降至 2% 以下。【原文：South Korea’s average economic growth rate will fall below 2% in the 2030s as aging demographics sap the nation’s vitality and strengthens headwinds for the economy, according to Bank of America projections.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司股票销售跻身自其首次公开募股以来全球规模最大的股票销售之列
item.description: 自五年前沙特将石油巨头阿美公司上市以来，沙特出让阿美公司的部分股份将筹集高达 120 亿美元的资金，是全球规模最大的股份出售交易之一。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s offer of a sliver of Aramco that will raise as much as $12 billion ranks among the largest share sales globally since the kingdom listed the oil giant five years ago.】

item.title: 英国房价三个月来首次上涨
item.description: 英国最大的抵押贷款机构之一表示，英国房价三个月来首次出现上涨，这是市场在借贷成本高企的情况下趋于稳定的一个迹象。【原文：UK house prices rose for the first time in three months, a sign that the market is stabilizing in the face of high borrowing costs, one of the biggest mortgage lenders said.】

item.title: 一度高歌猛进的亚洲对冲基金 Mass Ave 同意接受美国证券交易委员会的罚款
item.description: 据监管机构称，Mass Ave Global Inc. 及其联合创始人 Winston Feng 因向其旗舰亚洲对冲基金的投资者 "做出虚假和误导性陈述"，同意支付合计 60 万美元的罚款，以了结美国证券交易委员会的诉讼。【原文：Mass Ave Global Inc. and its co-founder Winston Feng agreed to pay a combined $600,000 in fines to settle US Securities and Exchange Commission proceedings for “making false and misleading statements” to investors in its flagship Asia hedge fund, according to the regulator.】

item.title: 受天气波动影响，小麦创乌克兰战争以来最大涨幅
item.description: 四月份，乌克兰农民尤里-塞克（Yurii Sekh）期待着小麦丰收。然而，该地区有史以来最干旱的一个麦季让这些希望破灭了。这也导致主粮价格飙升，再次引发了对粮食成本上升的担忧。【原文：In April, Ukrainian farmer Yurii Sekh was looking forward to a good wheat harvest. One of the driest Mays in the region’s records dashed those hopes. It also sent prices for the staple grain soaring, reviving fears of rising food costs.】

item.title: 历史表明，印度股市往往在投票后回报投资者
item.description: 印度股市在下周大选结果公布前出现波动，但如果历史可以作为指引，那么大选结果对长期投资者来说差别不大。【原文：Indian stocks have turned volatile ahead of election results due next week, but if history is any guide the outcome makes little difference to long-term investors.】
